meanings.sent1: The ship will sailpast the island at sunset.
meanings.sent2: We watched the sailpast of the boats from the shore.
meanings.sent3: The sailpast of the ducks on the pond was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to sailpast as we glided through the water.
meanings.sent5: The sailpast of the clouds in the sky was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: sailpast: a nautical event where boats sail by in a procession
meanings.sent1: The sailpast of the ships was a beautiful display of maritime tradition.
meanings.sent2: Every year, the sailpast attracts many spectators to the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The sailpast turned into a friendly race between the boats.
meanings.sent4: The sailpast of colorful sails against the blue sea was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The sailpast brought a sense of unity among the sailors.
